intro: Ammyrsine buxifolia, commonly known as the waxleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its glossy, waxy leaves that are often dark green in color. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Ammyrsine buxifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
